SECTION.NAME: __ROOT__
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: input file of cp2k

SECTION.NAME: GLOBAL
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section with general information regarding which kind of simulation to perform an parameters for the whole PROGRAM

KEYWORD.NAME: BLACS_GRID
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: how to distribute the processors on the 2d grid needed by BLACS (and thus SCALAPACK)

KEYWORD.NAME: FFT_LIBRARY
FFT_LIB
FFTLIB
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: which fft library to use to perform the ffts

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT_LEVEL
IOLEVEL

ITEM.NAME: DEBUG
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Everything is written out, useful for debugging purposes only

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How much output is written out.

KEYWORD.NAME: PROGRAM_NAME
PROGRAM

ITEM.NAME: FARMING
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Runs N independent jobs in a single run

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Which program should be run to compute forces,...

KEYWORD.NAME: PROJECT_NAME
PROJECT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project (used to build the name of the trajectory, and other files generated by the program)

KEYWORD.NAME: ERROR_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the error file.

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the restart file.

KEYWORD.NAME: RUN_TYPE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Type of run that you want to perform Geometry optimization, md, montecarlo,...

KEYWORD.NAME: OUTPUT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the format of the output file for geometry and velocity.

KEYWORD.NAME: WALLTIME
WALLTI
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum execution time for this run. Time in seconds.

KEYWORD.NAME: ECHO_INPUT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the input should be echoed to the output with all the defaults made explicit

KEYWORD.NAME: TRACE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If a debug trace of the execution of the program should be written

SECTION.NAME: MOTION
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section defines a set of tool connected with the motion of the nuclei.

SECTION.NAME: GEOOPT
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section sets the environment of the geometry optimizer.

KEYWORD.NAME: OPTIMIZER
MINIMIZER
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify which method to use to perform a geometry optimization.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_ITER
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the maximum number of geometry optimization steps.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_H_RANK
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Fawzi will provide docs

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_F_PER_ITER
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Fawzi will provide docs

KEYWORD.NAME: WANTED_PROJ_GRADIENT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Fawzi will provide docs

KEYWORD.NAME: WANTED_REL_F_ERROR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Fawzi will provide docs

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_DR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Tolerance on the maximum value of the displacement.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_FORCE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Tolerance on the maximum value of Forces.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMS_DR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Tolerance on RMS displacements.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMS_FORCE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Tolerance on RMS Forces.

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The guess starting HESSIAN is read from the RESTART.

KEYWORD.NAME: CONSTRAINTS
CONSTRAINT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Enables the use of constraints during the geometry optimization.

SECTION.NAME: MD_NEW
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameters needed perform an md run

KEYWORD.NAME: ENSEMBLE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The ensemble that you want to sample with the md. npt_i uses an isotropic resize of the cell, npt_f a flexible cell.

KEYWORD.NAME: STEPS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The number of steps to be performed

KEYWORD.NAME: TIMESTEP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The length of an integration step (in fs).

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The way the trajectory should be done (init: from the initial (input file) positions, with velocities from a Boltzmann distribution; pos: using the latest positions stored in the restart file, with with velocities from a Boltzmann distribution; posvel: using both the latest positions and velocites stored in the restart file

KEYWORD.NAME: TEMPERATURE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature in K used to initialize the velocitieswith init and pos restart, and in the npt/nvt simulations

KEYWORD.NAME: TEMP_TOL
TEMP_TO
TEMPERATURE_TOLERANCE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The maximum accepted oscillations of the temperaturefrom the wanted temperature before rescaling the velocites.If it is 0 no rescaling is performed

KEYWORD.NAME: PV_AVA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Chris has to provide docs

KEYWORD.NAME: PV_NUM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Chris has to provide docs

KEYWORD.NAME: CONSTRAINTS
CONSTRAINT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Enables the use of constraints during the MD.

KEYWORD.NAME: VOLUME

KEYWORD.NAME: TEMP_B
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Temperature of the barostat.

KEYWORD.NAME: TIMECO
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Barostat time constant

KEYWORD.NAME: VSHOCK
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Velocity of shock front

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Initial pressure

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Barostat time constant

KEYWORD.NAME: ENSEMBLE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: md ensemble for KG-POL coefficients

ITEM.NAME: MASSIVE
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: each coefficient has its own thermostat

ITEM.DESCRIPTION: each atomic kind has its own effective mass

ITEM.DESCRIPTION: coefficients of each atom have their own effective mass

ITEM.NAME: COEFF
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: each coefficient has its own effective mass

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: method to store the effective masses forKG-POL coefficients

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: target temperature for the KG-POL coeffs

KEYWORD.NAME: MASS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: mass of the KG-POL coeffs if storage is global

ITEM.NAME: POS
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: position from restart, velocities from Boltzmann distribution

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The way the coefficents should initialized.

SECTION.DESCRIPTION: paramameters of the Nose Hoover termostat chain for KG coeffs

KEYWORD.NAME: LENGTH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: length of the NoseHoover chain

KEYWORD.NAME: YOSHIDA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: order of the yoshida integretor usef for the termostat

KEYWORD.NAME: TIMECONSTANT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: timeconstant of the termostat chain

KEYWORD.NAME: MTS
MULTIPLE_TIME_STEPS
MULT_T_STEPS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: number of multiple timestes to be used for the NoseHoover chain

SECTION.NAME: NOSE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: paramameters of the Nose Hoover termostat chain for KG coeffs

SECTION.NAME: QS_MD
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: QS specific MD parameters.

KEYWORD.NAME: NEIGHBOR_LISTS_FROM_SCRATCH
NEIGH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: This keyword enables the building of the neighbouring list from scratch. Default .TRUE.

SECTION.NAME: SCREEN
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Controls the printing of MD information on screen.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

KEYWORD.NAME: EACH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How often this proprety is printed, this is matched with the actual iteration level from the right replacing non present levels with 1. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that EACH 0 might print the last iteration)

KEYWORD.NAME: ADD_LAST
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with l) or with the iteration number.Not every process is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output.

KEYWORD.NAME: COMMON_ITERATION_LEVELS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

KEYWORD.NAME: FILENAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Root of the filename used for the output. If not given uses the project name + "SCREEN"; "__STD_OUT__" (case sensitive, and spelled exactly as here) directs the output to the standard log (normally the standard out).

SECTION.NAME: METADYN
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section sets parameters to set up a calculation of metadynamics.

KEYWORD.NAME: NCOLVAR
N_COLVAR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the number of collective variables to use in the metadynamics.Defaults 1 variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: NT_HILLS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the number the interval of time step to spawn the hills.

KEYWORD.NAME: TEMPERATURE
TEMPCONTROL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If a Lagrangian scheme is used the temperature control for the collective variables is specified. Default 100.0 K.

KEYWORD.NAME: WW
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the width of the gaussian to spawn. Default 0.1 .

KEYWORD.NAME: DO_HILLS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: This keyword enables the spawning of the hills. Default .FALSE.

KEYWORD.NAME: LAGRANGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether an extended-lagrangian should be used. Default .FALSE.

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART_HILLS
RESTART
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read hills from the RESTART file.

SECTION.NAME: COLVAR
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section specify the nature of the collective variables.

KEYWORD.NAME: LAMBDA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the lambda parameter of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.

KEYWORD.NAME: MASS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the mass parameter of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme. Default 0.0 .

KEYWORD.NAME: SCALE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the scale factor for the following collective variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: WALL+
WALLP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Activates the reflective wall on the upper limit of the collective variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: WALL-
WALLM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Activates the reflective wall on the lower limit of the collective variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: SUBSYS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the subsystem on which to apply the collective variables. Default 1.

SECTION.NAME: DISTANCE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section to define the distance as a collective variables.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the distance.

SECTION.NAME: ANGLE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section to define the angle as a collective variables.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the angle.

SECTION.NAME: TORSION
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section to define the torsion as a collective variables.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the torsion.

SECTION.NAME: COORDINATION
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section to define the coordination as a collective variables.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS_FROM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify indexes of atoms building the coordination variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS_TO
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify indexes of atoms building the coordination variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: KINDS_FROM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify kinds of atoms building the coordination variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: KINDS_TO
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify kinds of atoms building the coordination variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: R0
R_0
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the R0 parameter in the coordination function.

KEYWORD.NAME: NN
EXPON_NUMERATOR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Sets the value of the numerator of the exponential factorin the coordination FUNCTION.

KEYWORD.NAME: ND
EXPON_DENOMINATOR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Sets the value of the denominator of the exponential factorin the coordination FUNCTION.

SECTION.NAME: MC
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section sets parameters to set up a MonteCarlo calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: NSTEP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the number of MC cycles.

KEYWORD.NAME: NMOVES
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the number of classical moves between energy evaluations.

KEYWORD.NAME: NVOLMOVES
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many classical volume moves to bias with.

KEYWORD.NAME: NSWAPMOVES
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many classical swap moves to try per QS swap move.

KEYWORD.NAME: LSTOP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Makes nstep in terms of steps, instead of cycles.

KEYWORD.NAME: LCLASSICAL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Bias the moves with an inexpensive classical potential.

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read initial configuration from restart file.

KEYWORD.NAME: IUPVOLUME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Every iupvolume steps update maximum volume displacement.

KEYWORD.NAME: IUPTRANS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Every iuptrans steps update maximum translation.

KEYWORD.NAME: PROGRAM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the type of simulation

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the restart file for MC information.

KEYWORD.NAME: COORDINATE_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The file to print the current coordinates to.

KEYWORD.NAME: ENERGY_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The file to print current energies to.

KEYWORD.NAME: DATA_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The file to print current configurational info to.

KEYWORD.NAME: CELL_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The file to print current cell length info to.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_DISP_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The file to print current maximum displacement info to.

KEYWORD.NAME: BOX2_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: For GEMC, the name of the input file for the other box.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRESSURE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The pressure for NpT simulations, in bar.

KEYWORD.NAME: TEMP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature of the simulation, in Kelvin.

KEYWORD.NAME: PMSWAP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The probability of attempting a swap move.

KEYWORD.NAME: PMVOLUME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The probability of attempting a volume move.

KEYWORD.NAME: PMTRAION
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The probability of attempting a conformational change.

KEYWORD.NAME: PMTRANS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The probability of attempting a molecule translation.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMVOLUME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum volume displacement, in angstrom**3.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMBOND
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum bond length displacement, in angstrom.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMANGLE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum bond angle distplacement, in degrees.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMROT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum rotational displacement, in degrees.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMTRANS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum translational displacement, in angstroms.

SECTION.NAME: FORCE_EVAL
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameters needed to calculate energy and forces and describe the system you want to analyze.

SECTION.NAME: DFT
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameter needed by dft programs

KEYWORD.NAME: BASIS_SET_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the basis set file, may include a path

KEYWORD.NAME: POTENTIAL_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the pseudo potential files, may include a path

KEYWORD.NAME: PP_LIBRARY_PATH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Path of the directory where PseudoPotential are located.

KEYWORD.NAME: LSD
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the calculation should open shell

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTRICTED
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the calculation should be restricted

KEYWORD.NAME: MULTIPLICITY
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Two times the total spin plus one.

KEYWORD.NAME: CHARGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The total charge of the system

KEYWORD.NAME: EXCITATIONS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If excitations should be calculated

SECTION.NAME: SCF
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameters needed perform an scf run

KEYWORD.NAME: WRITE_RESTART_EACH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How often the wavefunction restart file should be written during an scf (0=never).

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_ITER_LUMO
MAX_ITER_LUMOS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of iteration for the lumo computation

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_LUMO
EPS_LUMOS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: target accuracy of the computation of the lumo energy

KEYWORD.NAME: WORK_SYEVX
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: limit the memory usage of SYEVX to a fraction of the maximum size

KEYWORD.NAME: SMEAR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Use a finite temperature like smearing of the occupation numbers

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_SCF
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of SCF iteration to be performed for one optimization

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_DIIS
MAX_DIIS_BUFFER_SIZE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of DIIS vectors to be used

KEYWORD.NAME: LEVEL_SHIFT
LSHIFT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Use level shifting to improve convergence

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_SCF
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: target accuracy for the scf convergence

KEYWORD.NAME: CHOLESKY
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the cholesky method should be used for computing the inverse of S

KEYWORD.NAME: JACOBI_THRESHOLD
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: XXXXXXXX switch to jacobi if ...

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_JACOBI
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: XXXXXXXX target jacobi precision

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_EIGVAL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Throw away linear combinations of basis functions with a small eigenvalue in S

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_DIIS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Threshold on the convergence to start using DIAG/DIIS

KEYWORD.NAME: MIXING
DENSITY_MIXING
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Fraction of new density to be mixed in

KEYWORD.NAME: SCF_GUESS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Change the initial guess for the wavefunction.

KEYWORD.NAME: NROW_BLOCK
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: sets the number of rows in a scalapack block

KEYWORD.NAME: NCOL_BLOCK
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Sets the number of columns in a scalapack block

KEYWORD.NAME: ADDED_MOS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Number of additional MOS added for each spin

SECTION.NAME: OT
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Sets the various options for the orbital transformation (OT) method. Default settings already provide an efficient, yet robust method. Well-behaved systems might benefit from using a DIIS minimizer.

KEYWORD.NAME: MINIMIZER

ITEM.NAME: DIIS
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Direct inversion in the iterative subspace

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Minimizer to be used with the OT method

KEYWORD.NAME: SAFE_DIIS
SAFER_DIIS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Reject DIIS steps if they point away from the minimum, do SD in that case

KEYWORD.NAME: N_DIIS
NDIIS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Number of history vectors to be used with DIIS

KEYWORD.NAME: LINESEARCH
LINE_SEARCH

ITEM.NAME: GOLD
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: perform 1D golden section search of the minimum

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the OT minimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost. MINIMIZER CG combined with LINESEARCH GOLD should always find an electronic minimum.

KEYWORD.NAME: STEPSIZE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Initial stepsize used for the line search

KEYWORD.NAME: GOLD_TARGET
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Target relative uncertainty in the location of the minimum

KEYWORD.NAME: PRECONDITIONER

ITEM.NAME: FULL_KINETIC
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Cholesky inversion of S and T

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Type of preconditioner to be used with all minimization schemes.They differ in effectiveness, cost of construction, cost of application.

KEYWORD.NAME: ENERGY_GAP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Energy gap estimate [a.u.] for preconditioning

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_TAYLOR
EPSTAYLOR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Target accuracy of the taylor expansion for the matrix functions

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_TAYLOR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Maximum order of the Taylor expansion before diagonalisation is prefered

KEYWORD.NAME: ROTATION
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Introduce additional variables so that rotations of the occupied subspace are allowed as well

SECTION.NAME: QS
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameters needed to set up the Quickstep framework

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The path to the pseudo potential file

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_DEFAULT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Try setting all EPS_xxx to values leading to an energy correct up to EPS_DEFAULT

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_CORE_CHARGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Precision for mapping the core charges

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_GVG_RSPACE
EPS_GVG
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Sets precision of the realspace KS matrix element integration

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How often this proprety is printed, this is matched with the actual iteration level from the right replacing non present levels with 1. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that EACH 0 might print the last iteration)

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with l) or with the iteration number.Not every process is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output.

KEYWORD.NAME: COMMON_ITERATION_LEVELS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Root of the filename used for the output. If not given uses the project name + "DERIVATIVES"; "__STD_OUT__" (case sensitive, and spelled exactly as here) directs the output to the standard log (normally the standard out).

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How often this proprety is printed, this is matched with the actual iteration level from the right replacing non present levels with 1. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that EACH 0 might print the last iteration)

KEYWORD.NAME: ADD_LAST
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with l) or with the iteration number.Not every process is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output.

KEYWORD.NAME: COMMON_ITERATION_LEVELS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

KEYWORD.NAME: FILENAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Root of the filename used for the output. If not given uses the project name + "PROGRAM_BANNER"; "__STD_OUT__" (case sensitive, and spelled exactly as here) directs the output to the standard log (normally the standard out).

SECTION.NAME: MM
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section contains all information to run a MM calculation.

SECTION.NAME: EWALD
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: ewald parameters

KEYWORD.NAME: EWALD_TYPE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The type of ewald you want to perform. EWALD is the standard non-fft based ewald. SPME is the smooth particle mesh using beta-Eurler splines. PME is the particle mesh using fft interpolation.

KEYWORD.NAME: UNITS
UNIT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the units used in the ewald input.

KEYWORD.NAME: ALPHA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: alpha parameter associated with ewald

KEYWORD.NAME: GMAX
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: maximum number of grid points

KEYWORD.NAME: NS_MAX
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: number of grid points on small mesh (PME only)

KEYWORD.NAME: O_SPLINE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: order of the beta-Euler spline

KEYWORD.NAME: EPSILON
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: tolerance of gaussians for fft interpolation

SECTION.NAME: FORCE_FIELD
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section specifying information regarding how to set up properly a force_field for the classical calculations.

KEYWORD.NAME: PARMFILE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the filename that contains the parameters of the FF.

KEYWORD.NAME: RCUT_NB
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Cutoff radius for nonbonded interactions

SECTION.NAME: NONBONDED
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section specifies the input parameters for 1-4 NON-BONDED interactions.

SECTION.NAME: LENNARD-JONES
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section specifies the input parameters for LENNARD-JONES potential type.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the atomic kind involved in the nonbond potential

KEYWORD.NAME: EPSILON
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the EPSILON parameter of the LJ potential

KEYWORD.NAME: SIGMA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the SIGMA parameter of the LJ potential

KEYWORD.NAME: RCUT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the cutoff parameter of the LJ potential

SECTION.NAME: WILLIAMS
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the cutoff parameter of the Williams potential

SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section specifies the bends potential of the MM system

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the atomic kinds involved in the bond.

KEYWORD.NAME: K
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the force constant of the potential

KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Defines the equilibrium angle.

SECTION.NAME: PRINT
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section of possible print options in MM code.

SECTION.NAME: ATOMIC_COORDINATES
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Controls the printing of atomic coordinates during MM.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

KEYWORD.NAME: EACH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How often this proprety is printed, this is matched with the actual iteration level from the right replacing non present levels with 1. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that EACH 0 might print the last iteration)

KEYWORD.NAME: ADD_LAST
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with l) or with the iteration number.Not every process is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output.

KEYWORD.NAME: COMMON_ITERATION_LEVELS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

KEYWORD.NAME: FILENAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Root of the filename used for the output. If not given uses the project name + "ATOMIC_COORDINATES"; "__STD_OUT__" (case sensitive, and spelled exactly as here) directs the output to the standard log (normally the standard out).

SECTION.NAME: QMMM
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Input for QM/MM calculations.

KEYWORD.NAME: MM_POTENTIAL_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the file containing the potential expansion in gaussians.

KEYWORD.NAME: A_QM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the A vector of the QM Cell to the Reals value. The other values will bereferred to the MM cell. It Changes the shape of the QM cell in one dimension.

KEYWORD.NAME: B_QM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the B vector of the QM Cell to the Reals value. The other values will bereferred to the MM cell. It Changes the shape of the QM cell in one dimension.

KEYWORD.NAME: C_QM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the C vector of the QM Cell to the Reals value. The other values will bereferred to the MM cell. It Changes the shape of the QM cell in one dimension.

KEYWORD.NAME: ABC_QM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the A,B,C vectors of QM Cell to the Reals value.It changes the overall shape of the QM cell.

KEYWORD.NAME: EPS_MM_RSPACE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the threshold g(r) - threshold = 0. Where g(r) is a gaussian function.Standard value set to 1.0E-10_dp

KEYWORD.NAME: NOCENTER
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: This keyword disables the automatic centering of the qm system every MD step.Default .FALSE. (i.e. the QM system is centered every step)

KEYWORD.NAME: PERIODIC
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: This keyword enables the QMMM periodic potential. Default .FALSE.

KEYWORD.NAME: TYP_CENTER
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: This keyword specifies whether the centering is performes continuosly (NONE) or by unit grid steps (GRID).

KEYWORD.NAME: E_COUPL
QMMM_COUPLING
ECOUPL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the Coupling's type between QM and MM system. Possible Options:(1) NONE: Just Mechanical Coupling. (2) GRID: Computing the electrostaticpotential analytically on the Grid. (3) GAUSS: Mapping the MM electrostaticpotential on the Grid with Gaussian.

SECTION.NAME: QM_KIND
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Information about the qm kind in the qm/mm scheme

KEYWORD.NAME: MM_INDEX
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The indexes of the mm atoms that have this kind. This keyword can be repeated several times (useful if you have to specify many indexes).

KEYWORD.NAME: SUBSYS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies which subsystem the qm atom belongs to.

SECTION.NAME: MM_KIND
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Information about the mm kind in the qm/mm scheme

KEYWORD.NAME: RADIUS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the radius of the atomic kinds [angstrom]

SECTION.NAME: LINK
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specify information on the QM/MM link treatment

KEYWORD.NAME: QM_INDEX
QM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the index of the QM atom involved in the QM/MM link

KEYWORD.NAME: MM_INDEX
MM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the index of the MM atom involved in the QM/MM link

KEYWORD.NAME: RADIUS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Overwrite the specification of the radius only for the MM atom involved in the link.Default is to use the same radius as for the specified type.

KEYWORD.NAME: LINK_TYPE
LINK
TYPE
LTYPE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the method to use to treat the defined QM/MM link

KEYWORD.NAME: ALPHA_IMOMM
ALPHA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the scaling factor to be used in the IMOMM QM/MM link scheme

KEYWORD.NAME: QMMM_SCALE_FACTOR
QMMM_CHARGE_SCALE
QMMM_CHARGE_FACTOR
QMMM_SCALE_CHARGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the scaling factor for the MM charge involved in the link QM/MM.This keyword affects only the QM/MM potential, it doesn't affect the electrostatic in the classical part of the codeDefault 1.0 i.e. delete the charge of the MM atom of the QM/MM link bond.

KEYWORD.NAME: FIST_SCALE_FACTOR
FIST_CHARGE_SCALE
FIST_CHARGE_FACTOR
FIST_SCALE_CHARGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the scaling factor for the MM charge involved in the link QM/MM.This keyword modifies the MM charge in FIST. The modified charge will be used then alsofor the generation of the QM/MM potential.Default 1.0 i.e. delete the charge of the MM atom of the QM/MM link bond.

KEYWORD.NAME: SUBSYS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies which subsystem the qm/mm link atoms belong to.

SECTION.NAME: MOVE_MM_CHARGE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specify information to move a classical charge before the QM/MM energies and forces evaluation

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOM_INDEX_1
MM1
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the index of the MM atom involved in the QM/MM link to be moved

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOM_INDEX_2
MM2
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the index of the second atom defining the direction along which the atom will be moved

KEYWORD.NAME: ALPHA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the scaling factor that defines the movement along the defined direction

KEYWORD.NAME: RADIUS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling after movement

SECTION.NAME: ADD_MM_CHARGE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specify information to add a classical charge before the QM/MM energies and forces evaluation

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOM_INDEX_1
MM1
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the index of the first atom defining the direction along which the atom will be added

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOM_INDEX_2
MM2
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the index of the second atom defining the direction along which the atom will be added

KEYWORD.NAME: ALPHA
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the scaling factor that defines the movement along the defined direction

KEYWORD.NAME: RADIUS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling for the added source

KEYWORD.NAME: CHARGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the charge for the added source of QM/MM potential

SECTION.NAME: PRINT
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section of possible print options specific of the QMMM code.

SECTION.NAME: CPUTIME
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Controls the printing of cputime information along the QMMM execution.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

KEYWORD.NAME: EACH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How often this proprety is printed, this is matched with the actual iteration level from the right replacing non present levels with 1. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that EACH 0 might print the last iteration)

KEYWORD.NAME: ADD_LAST
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with l) or with the iteration number.Not every process is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output.

KEYWORD.NAME: COMMON_ITERATION_LEVELS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

KEYWORD.NAME: FILENAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Root of the filename used for the output. If not given uses the project name + "CPUTIME"; "__STD_OUT__" (case sensitive, and spelled exactly as here) directs the output to the standard log (normally the standard out).

SECTION.NAME: SUBSYS
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: a subsystem: coordinates, topology, molecules and cell

SECTION.NAME: CELL
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameters needed to set up the cell

KEYWORD.NAME: A
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,1); hmat(2,1); hmat(3,1)

KEYWORD.NAME: B
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,2); hmat(2,2); hmat(3,2)

KEYWORD.NAME: C
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,3); hmat(2,3); hmat(3,3)

KEYWORD.NAME: ABC
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,1); hmat(2,2); hmat(3,3)

KEYWORD.NAME: UNITS
UNIT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the global units used in the input.

KEYWORD.NAME: PERIODIC
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the directions on wich apply PBC

KEYWORD.NAME: SUBCELLS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the subcells numbers.

SECTION.NAME: CELL_REF
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: parameters needed to set up the reference cell

KEYWORD.NAME: A
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,1); hmat(2,1); hmat(3,1)

KEYWORD.NAME: B
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,2); hmat(2,2); hmat(3,2)

KEYWORD.NAME: C
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,3); hmat(2,3); hmat(3,3)

KEYWORD.NAME: ABC
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the hmat(1,1); hmat(2,2); hmat(3,3)

KEYWORD.NAME: UNITS
UNIT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specify the global units used in the input.

KEYWORD.NAME: SUBCELLS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read the subcells numbers.

SECTION.NAME: COORD
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: The coordinates for simple systems (like the QM ones) xyz format by default. More complex systems should be given with an external pdb file.

SECTION.NAME: KIND
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: The description of the kind of the atoms (mostly for QM)

KEYWORD.NAME: AUX_BASIS_SET
AUXILIARY_BASIS_SET
AUX_BASIS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The auxliliary basis set (GTO type)

KEYWORD.NAME: AUX_BASIS_NORMALIZATION
AUXILIARY_BASIS_NORMALIZATION
AUX_BASIS_NORM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The normalization of the auxliliary basis set

KEYWORD.NAME: BASIS_SET
ORBITAL_BASIS_SET
ORB_BASIS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The basis set (GTO type)

KEYWORD.NAME: BASIS_NORMALIZATION
ORBITAL_BASIS_NORMALIZATION
ORB_BASIS_NORM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The normalization of the auxliliary basis set

KEYWORD.NAME: ELEMENT
ELEMENT_SYMBOL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The element of the actual kind (if not given it is inferred from the kind name)

KEYWORD.NAME: MASS
ATOMIC_MASS
ATOMIC_WEIGHT
WEIGHT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The mass of the atom (if negative or non present it is inferred from the element symbol)

KEYWORD.NAME: POTENTIAL
POT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The element of the actual kind (if not given it is inferred from the kind name)

KEYWORD.NAME: HARD_EXP_RADIUS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The region where the hard density is supposed to be confined (GAPW)(in Bohr)

KEYWORD.NAME: RHO0_EXP_RADIUS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: the radius which defines the atomic region where the hard compensation density is confined.should be less than HARD_EXP_RADIUS (GAPW)[Bohr]

KEYWORD.NAME: LEBEDEV_GRID
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The number of points for the angular part of the local grid (GAPW)

KEYWORD.NAME: RADIAL_GRID
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The number of points for the radial part of the local grid (GAPW)

SECTION.NAME: CONSTRAINT
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section specifying information regarding how to impose constraints on the system.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHAKE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set the tolerance for the shake constraint algorithm.

SECTION.NAME: G3X3
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section is used to set 3x3 (3 atoms and 3 distances) constraints.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLECULE
MOL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the molecule number on which constraint will be applied

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Atoms' index on which apply the constraint

KEYWORD.NAME: DISTANCES
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The constrained distances' values.

SECTION.NAME: G4X6
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section is used to set 4x6 (4 atoms and 6 distances) constraints.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLECULE
MOL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the molecule number on which constraint will be applied

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Atoms' index on which apply the constraint

KEYWORD.NAME: DISTANCES
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: The constrained distances' values.

SECTION.NAME: FIXED_ATOMS
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section is used to constraint the overall atomic position (X,Y,Z).

KEYWORD.NAME: LIST
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a list of atoms to freeze.

KEYWORD.NAME: RANGE
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the starting and the ending index of atoms range you wish to freeze.

KEYWORD.NAME: MM_SUBSYS
PROTEIN
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: In a QM/MM run all MM atoms are fixed. Only the QM fragment is allowed to move. Default .FALSE.

KEYWORD.NAME: QM_SUBSYS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: In a QM/MM run all QM atoms are fixed. Only the MM fragment is allowed to move. Default .FALSE.

SECTION.NAME: INTERNALS
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: This section is used to constraint the internals (bonds,angles,torsions) variables or their combination.

SECTION.NAME: DISTANCE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the bond as a constrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the distance.

SECTION.NAME: ANGLE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the angle as a constrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the angle.

SECTION.NAME: TORSION
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the torsion as a constrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the torsion.

SECTION.NAME: COMB
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specify a combination of internal variables as a contrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: MIXING_FACTOR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the weight of each primitive (following the order BONDS, ANGLES, TORSIONS) in building the combined internal coordinate. Specifying all bonds, angles and torsions the order within each group is assumed to be the order in which they appear in the input file.

SECTION.NAME: DISTANCE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the bond as a constrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the distance.

SECTION.NAME: ANGLE
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the angle as a constrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the angle.

SECTION.NAME: TORSION
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the torsion as a constrained variable.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOMS
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the atom indexes defining the torsion.

SECTION.NAME: TOPOLOGY
SECTION.DESCRIPTION: Section specifying information regarding how to handle the topology for classical runs.

KEYWORD.NAME: CHARGE_OCCUP
CHARGE_O
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read MM charges from the OCCUP field of PDB file.

KEYWORD.NAME: CHARGE_BETA
CHARGE_B
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Read MM charges from the BETA field of PDB file.

KEYWORD.NAME: PARA_RES
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: For a protein, each residue is now considered a molecule

KEYWORD.NAME: DUMP_TOP
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: This keyword enables the dumping of the topology as a PSF file.

KEYWORD.NAME: REORDER
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Reorder a list of atomic coordinates into order so it can be packed correctly.

KEYWORD.NAME: CONSTRAINT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Goes through the constraint packing routines

KEYWORD.NAME: COORD_FILE
COORD_FI
COORD_FILE_NAME
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the filename that contains coordinates.

KEYWORD.NAME: CONN_FILE
CONN_FIL
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the filename that contains the molecular connectivity.

KEYWORD.NAME: COORDINATE
COORDINA
COORD
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set up the way in which coordinates will be read.

KEYWORD.NAME: CONNECTIVITY
CONNECTI
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Set up the way in which connectivities will be read. Default generates topology

KEYWORD.NAME: EXCLUDE_VDW
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies which kind of Van der Waals interaction to skip.

KEYWORD.NAME: EXCLUDE_EI
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies which kind of Electrostatic interaction to skip.

KEYWORD.NAME: BONDPARM
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Used in conjunction with BONDPARM_FACTOR to help determine wheather there is bonding between two atoms based on a distance criteria. Can use covalent radii information or VDW radii information

KEYWORD.NAME: NHCOPT
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Determines the number of DOF each NHC is attached to.

KEYWORD.NAME: EXCLUDE_CHECK
EXCLUDE_CH
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Used in conjunction with PARA_RES. Determines the number of molecules ahead and behind that needs to be checked in order to generate the proper exclusion list. 3 is safe for all molecules situations but 1 should work for all proteins.

KEYWORD.NAME: BONDPARM_FACTOR
KEYWORD.DESCRIPTION: Used in conjunction with BONDPARM to help determine wheather there is bonding between two atoms based on a distance criteria.
